_decoded_content.title: ELT Meaning, Advantages & More: All You Need To Know To Get Started- Blog
_decoded_content.description:
### Activity 
The new web agency sent us an example blog on ETL vs ELT that I am repurposing copy from to do a blog post. This is not to compete with or be a substitute for AJ's upcoming post. It is just more material on the topic to show our robust expertise. 

see [**draft of article in WP**](https://meltano.com/blog/wp-admin/post.php?post=1598&action=edit)


### Todos

- [ ] @afolson can you help review the post for accuracy and if possible help flush out copy for the benefits if ELT bullet points 
- [ ] I will continue to revise for SEO

_decoded_content.title: Repurposed Content
_decoded_content.description:
What top-performing content can we get more airplay with minor refreshes:

* Taylor and Emilie's talk - [Run Your Data Team Like A Product Team](https://locallyoptimistic.com/post/run-your-data-team-like-a-product-team/)
  * need to get permission from them and Emilie to repost to our blog or repurpose for newsletter
  * Revision DRI: Taylor
* Douwe on SED podcast- [Meltano: ELT for DataOps with Douwe Maan](https://podcasts.google.com/feed/aHR0cHM6Ly9mZWVkcy5tZWdhcGhvbmUuZm0vU0VENDg0Mzk4MTQwMQ/episode/NjdhMjA4ODAtZGEwNS0xMWViLWI1YzYtNzc4ZDAyZWQwNGI2?hl=en&ved=2ahUKEwjh2_PhoJPyAhXYQs0KHTKdDjEQjrkEegQIBxAL&ep=6)
  * Revision DRI: TBD- try to find ghost editor
* Data Engineer podcast- [Leveling Up Open Source Data Integration With Meltano Hub And The Singer SDK](https://www.dataengineeringpodcast.com/meltano-singer-data-integration-improvements-episode-200/)
  * Revision DRI: TBD- try to find ghost editor
* vision blog post that Taylor did- https://meltano.com/blog/2021/04/09/our-vision-for-the-future-of-meltano/ 
  * Revision DRI: Taylor

## Others that need more work:
- If you want this come build it with us- this is a community effort to build the data tool we wish existed
  * owner: Douwe
- ELT vs ETL (blog paired with webpage)
  * owner: AJ
- Why singer is best protocol
  * owner: AJ
- Why open source going to win data integration
  * owner: Taylor
- Why org should want data ops and single source of truth collab
  * owner: Taylor
- End to end DataOps
- Data shifting left?
- Future of data and why it matters
- Data lifecycle 
- Cook books

_decoded_content.title: DataOps (data stack) Book
_decoded_content.description:
Hoping we can get a publication out on Dataops. Goal is to make Meltano the first name associated with and the authority on DataOps. It could also be a white paper to start. 

Groups to work with (there can be many):
- [x] O'Reilly- email to reach out
- [ ] [For dummies series](https://www.dummies.com/custom-solutions/contact-us-confirmation/#gf_1) we might have to pay for this but it could be a great asset to hand out and sign at future events. - Emily put out inquiry 
- [x] Packt
- [ ] self-publishing (not suggested as it will require much higher promotion costs and efforts, plus we have no established ghostwriters)
- [ ] others?

---
## Draft of book outline

_decoded_content.title: HackerOne Content Ideas
_decoded_content.description:
[Per AJ on Slack](https://meltano.slack.com/archives/C027405T4G1/p1626198123007800):

Came up in our discussion with HackerOne today, some common challenges we could perhaps turn into thought leadership articles:
- [ ] How to work with (and not break) downstream BI teams. (Creating layers of transform to reduce impact, strategically adding tests and queries from the BI layer, etc.)
- [ ] How to add Meltano to an existing ELT data pipeline ecosystem.
- [ ] Four "types of work" in a data project and where they should "live" in the business: EL (centrally managed replication), Core Transforms (centrally-managed), Team-Owned Transforms (distributed), BI Layer (distributed and centrally managed).
- [X] Strategies for performing a phased adoption and migration from Fivetran to Meltano.

Link to video: https://meltano.slack.com/archives/G01PY2PV6UR/p1626197758045700?thread_ts=1626191161.038600&cid=G01PY2PV6UR

<!-- Labels to add for triaging -->
